title: The Collected Stories Of Lydia Davis
author: Lydia Davis
reflection:
What Davis aims to do in her writing is portray the elasticity of our consciousness and emotions. 
  I just love how her writing gives up the orthodxy of traditional fiction.

comments.comment:
I almost didn't want to tell anyone I was reading this because it blew my mind so hard that I'd almost prefer it to have been a dream or something.
 Let's just never mention it.
comments.name: Bob Segle

comments.comment:
Been picking through these for a while now. How much can be said with so little. Get in closer. Read every word.
 They form a collective memory, although being discrete pieces.
comments.name: Krystal Le

comments.comment:
Life rarley gives us closure and what Davis certainly doesn't give us in her writing is closure.
 That's life.
comments.name: Sarah Stayle

comments.comment: I read the Chinese version with English translation. I was most impressed with this observation: that winning every war is not the best scenario; the most ideal scenario is where one manages to repel an enemy without fighting. The other theory I found convincing is that a shrewd fighter would choose his men wisely and would know how to ride the prevailing situation. Most of the contents would seem to be practical common sense.
comments.name: Alice Poon
